The room was fantastic with a king sized bed and all of the amenities that usually accompany a DoubleTree hotel room. The property is far enough away from the nightlife of downtown to allow you to get a good nights sleep. Also it is within walking distance of the convention center if that is your destination. The staff was very helpful and the business center provides free Internet access in case you want to print out your boarding pass without incurring a fee. The parking lot was confusing. I am certain that there were more than the 12 spots that I saw when I tried to park. It is my own fault for not following up with the staff to ascertain how to access the other sections of the parking lot, so I won' t hold that against the hotel. Since I obtained this booking via priceline.com, the rate was very good, probably due to the construction. I would not expect to get the same rate at this hotel once the construction is completed.Excellent all the way around. Very accommodating, nice rooms and convenient! Thank you!Hotel is pretty nice- great location- very clean- gave it three stars instead of four because the televisions in the rooms are the same model I had in my college dorm room in 1989- could use a little updating- got in early on Sunday afternoon to hopefully catch the football games...Room was decent - no thrills - good selection of HD channels. Wifi could have been better...Room service was affordable.
review_content_40: how do they give you a warm cookie when you check in? i'm not sure but they do!everything went well with my stay at the double tree hotel, i ate the fish and chips, which was very different than fish and chips i'm used to.  i'm real glad that i ordered a salad to go with my huge piece of fried fish and steak fries.my next door neighbor woke me up for 1 hr by watching infomercials really loud on their tv from 4am-5am (and i was on pst time so that's 1-2am for me).oh, and they had everything i needed in the bathroom except shaving cream, which is pretty standard.Stayed here while in town visiting family.  The accomodations are nice and the price is right.  Has a great location right in uptown Charlotte.  The place will also accept pets which is a big thumbs up in my book!  I ate breakfast in the hotel every day - it has the typical assortment of breakfast food and it was ok.Nice hotel, nice warm cookies!  I have stayed at this one twice and would recommend to out of towners.I stayed at this hotel while in town for a meeting. The hotel was close to all the hot spots, located in a trendy part of town. This was a great deal on Priceline for $49. The room was well decorated and look to have been recently renovated. Great area for walking , Starbucks and other shops across the street.

review_content: I like the Westin CharlotteAnd it's not just because the chandelier in their lobby is the size of my apartment. It's because in that lobby, they also have a mini Starbucks. And they also have a large parking garage that is attached to the hotel. And the hotel rooms are nice. And the front desk attendant I dealt with was really nice and cute. And their hotel bar is huge. And the last reason I like the Westin Charlotte is... it's so large, that I did not have to use my google maps to find it when I was walking back from the outskirts of downtown. It's also a stop on the light rail!The hotel itself was pretty nice - unfortunately, there were a few very important things that caused this stay to be a bad experience for our trip.The valet service is HORRIBLE & DANGEROUS.1)  When arriving back to the hotel on Saturday night/Sunday morning, as we were pulling in, one of the valet men came speeding out of the garage full speed and almost hit our car.  He didn't apologize or even acknowledge almost doing it.  We had to slam on our breaks so hard it shifted many things around in the car and screeched the tires.2)  When checking out of the hotel on Sunday morning, our car (which was a rental car, might I add), had the fresh smell of cigarette smoke in it, as if someone had been smoking and put out their cigarette as they were getting in the car and blew the smoke in the car.  We had to roll the windows down in the very cold weather to get the stench out on the way to the airport.3)  The same valet man gave us wrong directions to the airport, sending us north of Charlotte.  Luckily, I was somewhat familiar with the area and could tell that we weren't going the right way, and turned us around.  This, however, made me have to get more gas in the car - which we had pre-paid for gas and had it set to deliver it back very close to empty.  Instead, I had to pay for more gas to ensure that we didn't run out because of the 20 miles off track we were.  ALSO, this made us almost miss our flight.  Thankfully, security was moving people fairly fast on Sunday.4)  When I have tried to contact valet management, I continue to get voicemail.  I tried to speak with one of the hotel managers, but the operator kept sending me to a answering machine.  After a while, I finally told the operator, 'I want to speak to a frigging manager - quit sending me to voicemail!'.  HOWEVER - after saying this, she transferred me to a lady who answered saying - 'Hello - this is one of the F'ING managers - how's your day?' in a very smirky tone.5)  Finally, after e-mailing the man that continues to ask that people on this site e-mail him directly with their issues about all of this, I never received any sort of reply.Wonderful location, minutes walk from the center of Uptown and other venues such as the BoA Stadium. Right next to the light rail so super convenient to get where ever you need to be. The interior is of the hotel is quite good, though is getting a little dated. The bed is very comfortable and the linen was clean and crisp. The room's size was okay and the bathroom was on the small side. The bathroom light was quite dim, but shower pressure and soaps was also very good. WiFi was quite fast and reasonable for the price. I had a room facing Uptown, and the Westin had very large windows, allowing me to look out of the beautiful skyline. I will definitely be back.We stayed on the 18th floor looking out over the city. It was fantastic.We were greeted immediately in the driveway by our valet. He was well-dressed, courteous and  he was quick with jokes that were actually funny.  Totally professional crew outside working three or four cars at a time with ease. Great process.We entered the the reception area and we were totally impressed with the chandeliers, beautiful  marble and travertine tiling designs on the floors and walls.  The look was pure luxury and it seemed that every few feet there was a Westin employee helping someone or offering a greeting to you as they passed us in route to a very important task.The room,  oh my, the room was/is fabulous.  The bed was covered in white full of feather pillows and egyptian cotton linen.  I have not slept that welll in months.  I loved sleeping on that mattress, the bed is my new bestie.  Smiles!  The room had a HUGE football game watching TV set with a crystal clear picture.  All my TNT shows were wonderful in stereo sound.  Closet space was scrumptious - double wide and double deep. My dream closet.  I measured it and wrote down the specifications for my builder cousin coming in for Thanksgiving.  I must have that closet at home.The bathroom was luxe covered in cocoa brown marble tile.  The shower was equipped with a huge rain showerhead and handheld pulsating spray total heaven for neck and shoulder muscles.  I liked the mirror and lighting combination.  But you will lauugh but I LOVED the tall toilet that allowed you to sit down and not drop down, seriously important as you age. Ha Ha!Big box hotel.Went to the bar for a glass of wine---unbelievable.  The bar was out of pinot noir, merlot and malbac.  Basically what was some dubious cab.  The bar was understaffed for the big convention that apparently was in the hotel.We put a door hanger our for breakfast (yogurt and coffee) to be delivered at 7.  At 8 am and two phone calls, still no coffee.  No apologies.   First phone call at 7:35 we were told it was on its way.  Second phone call at 7:50, they are sending it up "right now."The carpet in the room is very stained and worn (staring at it as I type and wishing I had flip flops to I would not have to walk on it).  Big box, impersonal hotel.  The views are not worth it.PS....8:30 and still no coffee or breakfast.  Time to check out and never come back.  Will upload photos in another review.This is the one hotel in uptown Charlotte that I don't mind coming back to, since it meets my expectations nearly every time. Since arriving here for the first time for a convention in 08', followed b subsequent conventions and business meetings, the Westin Charlotte has been a welcoming accommodation that continues to leave an impression after each visit.The first impression easily was the Heavenly beds. I've never slept in a better bed in a hotel prior to this visit, nor since. This bed set the benchmark so high with me that I purchased a comparable model a couple of years later at a pretty penny. The rooms within the Westin Charlotte are standard Westin: a littler smaller than expected, with the bed dominating a good portion of the space. The standard amenities of the pool area, gym and so forth met expectations. The front desk staff is very, very good, in addition to the banquet staff when it comes to accommodating colleagues that are in for a convention. The bar area across the floor from the front desk is one of my favorite places to network with professionals as much as I do drink. Known as "The Lobby Bar", the area is set up strictly as one to rendezvous with business associates and friends during events primarily after 5 PM. The menu is moderately reasonable for beer drafts, yet a little pricier for hors d' oeuvres and cocktails. If you can get your company to approve drinks and appetizers under T&E, it is highly advised. Parking is so-so. While the convenience to park within the underground lot is appreciated, I really think that it should be marked better with regard to where the elevator is in relation to the section of where your car is. It took me nearly 20 minutes to find my car at one point!Altogether, the Westin Charlotte can be a place to really enjoy. A little pricey, yet worth it if you prefer a downtown (they call it uptown in Charlotte) location while either traveling or on business.I aboslutely loved this hotel! My co-worker and multiple people I spoke to even mentioned how good it smelt- that's how you know it's a great hotel! haha no lingering smell of mildew or mold, it was so fresh and clean.The beds were so extremely comfortable, i never wanted to get out of bed! They have a great service where if you'd like to skip your room cleaning for the day they'd give you a $5 gift card for going green.This hotel also features a deal I've never heard of before and sadly didn't take advantage of.. You can rent workout gear for $5. They will send New Balance shoes and clothing to your room! for $5! Such a steal if you dont' have room in your carry on for extra items.Stayed on the 24th floor for one night for work. Hand's down I had one of my best night's sleep on a foreign bed ever! The hotel staff was courteous and friendly all around! I especially loved the waterfall shower head and Starbuck's coffee in each guest room. Nice touches!Came here for New Year's Eve . The music was terrible , to buy a drink I had to spend 30mins in a line first to buy a ticket and then buy a drink in another line . Total time spent 1 hour for a $15 drink . Want my money backComfortable stay and good customer service.  $20 a day for self-parking in uptown Charlotte seems a bit extreme.  This is what I would expect to pay in a larger city.  Housekeeping forgot to supply clean towels one afternoon and promised to come back with some but never did.  We were left with 2 washcloths and that was it.  Housekeeping was also always knocking on our door by 9 am to see if they could clean the room.  When we were not ready to leave the room for the day, they seemed a little irritated.  The room was very nice sized and the felt clean and light.  I would stay here again but it didn't knock my socks off.AVOID THE VALET AT ALL COSTS!The valet curbed 3 of my 4 rims on my new BMW and refused to pay for the damages.Couldn't me happier with my stay in the Westin!I proposed to my girlfriend now fiance and the staff here made it all the better. They helped me set up, sent champagne and nibbles and even gave me an upgrade so I could show my fiance the best time of her life. Her staycation, our engagement, the whole experience was fantastic and I look forward to staying there again soon!This is a good option downtown especially if you have an event at the convention center. You can walk to everything from here. Overall this is a good choice for the area. The decor is nice, but could use some updating. The staff is friendly. The rooms are inline with expectations. I do not like having to pay for internet, especially daily, so that was a mild inconvenience. There are two bar options in the hotel. There is also a cafe that serves Starbucks and some breakfast pastries. There is a restaurant on site as well. I only tried it for breakfast. That was very disappointing but i will save that for my review of it.Absolutely the best!  I stayed here this weekend for the V-WISE conference.  The room, food and staff was fantastic.  I will definitely stay here againI was a manager at a six-star hotel with 2,800 rooms in downtown Seoul. So, I might have high standards. I really liked my experience there working for Avon Walk twice, competing at World Affairs Council World Quest twice, and hanging out with friends. So I almost gave it four stars. But I have to be professional. I do see a lot of things that i would change if I were running it.That doesn't mean that it isn't good. It still is a nice hotel. Some people just love Westin for what it is. Not too fancy but one of the big boys. But the way the guests were lined up and waiting in the small lobby in multiple direction was difficult to overlook. There were some even blocking the entrance.The nice things about it is that it's in the right place. Location, location, location. It's in the center city, yet not right beside the biggest businesses and heavy traffic. The overstreet mall isn't connected to the hotel, if I remember correctly, but everything is in walking distance. And if you are in the city for conventions, or a professional sports game, it's a perfect place to stay.I have also been to most other popular hotels in Charlotte. The city doesn't have a Four Seasons, Wardorf Astoria type of a hotel. So for what it offers, it's pretty good. So enjoy it.I stayed at the Westin for business travel about a month ago and found it to be wonderful.  The people were warm and welcoming - from the valets to the front desk.  Pierre was especially kind on this late night and helped make me feel welcome.  The next morning, one of the valets (forgot his name), helped me get a black car to one of the buildings because it was raining hard. The room was clean, fresh and had the conveniences I expected.  Breakfast buffet was good - price was higher than I would pay personally, but very nice restaurant and quiet.I was here for a wedding this past weekend and the staff @ The Westin were great. Able to get an early check-in and had the lovely Savannah check us in. The 25th floor housekeeper organized everything so well (I have a bit OCD and it was perfect) Front desk specialist Pierre was friendly and informative on the local whereabouts. Very happy the Westin believes in customer service.I like the Westin. The lobby is adequate, rooms are predictable and safe. If you love beige, you'll love the interior decorator's style. Views: Nonexistent (it is Charlotte after all, what are you expecting to see, suburbs?). Water was hot, beds are cozy and clean. I didn't see a single cockroach.Like any large metro hotel you'll see a interesting variety of people - business peeps for a conference, kids on a tour all wearing the same coordinated clothes, and random weirdos (like me). And of course on the right weekend when there is a game - lots of Cowboys fans. People watching is a sport in itself - all the tarted up ladies (welcome to The South y'all) and kids freaking out.Lets talk about the bar. The first night I went I got served twice with STRONG drinks (negroni, then gin & tonic), and only $10 bucks. I'm gonna like this place, I thought - I wonder if the locals come here knowing the drinks are strong. But alas... the SECOND night I ordered a whisky sour and it was basically sour mix. When I subsequently ordered a double it came back with a shot floating in the top and... wait for it.... the charge was $24. Yep, you read that right - they charged me for TWO drinks (and for some reason added on a $2/drink charge). I asked for snacks, and they served me some peanut things that were wet. I guess the dish was still wet from the dishwasher. So it was soggy snacks.And finally, one of my drinks was served in a hot glass (straight from the washer??) So it's quickly melting and getting warm. Bartending 101 dudes. I knew the score because the night before a woman asked for them to repour her martini in a COLD glass. Apparently her glass was hot. At the time I was thinking - what a b*tch, but then it happened to me. Sigh.They also charge for internet usage, because apparently the owners think it's 1995.I didn't stay at the restaurant. My friends said it was $26 for a breakfast buffet. Ouch.Parking will add another $20 / night.These little things added up. The Westin has this vibe of trying to be a nice fancy uppity hotel - people waiting to call cabs for you (we used Uber, half the price), and when my bill was emailed to me they called it a "guest folio" instead of a "bill".... all fancyshmancypantsy - but the thing is they miss the details like a competent bar, and they nickel and dime you for things like internet... in 2015.Pros: Clean, predictable rooms, fast elevator, people watching.Cons: Bar is hot mess, nickled and dimed for fees, beige.Had a room overlooking the city but the seals in the window were broken and it was a foggy blur. Staff was supposed to help with a reservation and dropped the ball. They double billed my credit card for the room. The hotel is starting to look warn and needs investment.I'm in my room as I write this review. Being so close to the convention center, I assumed the place would be more pristine. I was wrong. While the room is fine, it's only fine. It's not the cleanest room I've seen by a long shot. The air conditioning vent is extremely dusty as is the majority of the furniture. The bed seems clean but as with most hotels, there are layers and layers of linens which are meant to feel plush but just get tangled and feel hot in the middle of the night.Finally the self parking is $20 a night which is just much too expensive for a city like Charlotte. Being from DC I'm experienced with pricy parking but $20 a night in a small city like Charlotte is just ridiculous!
review_content_20: Very nice hotel in a pretty good location - you can walk out the door into downtown, you are just on the  outskirts.   Super clean, the lap pool is the perfect temperature, gym has lots of equipment.  The restaurant is closed for repairs, so unable to comment and that was a bit inconvenient.   Parking is rough through - $20/day.I stay in a LOT of hotels. The Westin in Charlotte is easily staffed with the nicest, most accommodating staff of pretty much any hotel I have been to...and compared to other hotels I stay at in this category, it is also one of the least expensive. Besides the Ritz, it is by far the nicest of all the hotels I've stayed at while working in Charlotte. The food is pretty good, the bars are nice and its close to my office. When the Westin is not available when I come down, I am very disappointed.Used to be a lot better but I hear they are renovating?Used to be clean and luxurious but last visit I had bugs in my bathroom lamps, stained carpet and broken furniture.I give 3 stars for prior visits and hope the smelly, broken rooms get fixed soon, as its actually a prime downtown charlotte spot!This has to be the worst "luxury" hotel I've ever stayed at. First off, I was staying here for a conference and had requested a higher floor room, but was given a 4th floor room - which is the lowest floor for rooms. I had also requested a King size bed since my wife was travelling with me, but we were given two double beds. In addition to not being able to sleep with my wife during the stay, I couldn't even fit comfortably on the bed (I'm 6' 4" so I always get a King bed). But I usually don't make a fuss about these kind of things when I'm at conference because I'm not paying for it anyway. The room itself was just okay - nothing wrong with it, but perhaps the most underwhelming room I've ever had at a supposedly luxury hotel. The only positive is that the bed itself was comfortable - would have been nice to have that King bed though, of course. Many of the hotel staff seemed rude and inappropriate in situations - including the onsite Hertz staff. Obviously management is not training well for customer service at this location. Plus I had went to the front desk to get my key card "keyed" for use in the parking garage because I had rented a car there, but they couldn't even manage to get this right. I never could get the key card to work in the parking garage. Conference rooms were poorly set-up, freezing cold, and loud! The walls were paper thin and it was at times very difficult to hear the presentations because sound from the other presentations next door would drift through - this was especially a problem in the back of the conference rooms. Attendees often were left standing at the back of the room because not enough chairs were set up.Perhaps for Charlotte this is a nice property, but for those of us who have traveled around a bit, this place falls very far short on the luxury scale. If you are in Charlotte for travel and have an option to choose where to stay, I'd recommend the much nicer looking Hilton down the street - that's a nice looking property and Hilton is always good. Not recommended.***The Westin Charlotte has a great location in Downtown Charlotte (within walking distance to so many key Charlotte attractions) and the hotel is contemporary and comfortable***While I mostly stay at Marriott hotels, Westin hotels (of Starwood) are nice and typically more contemporary than Marriotts.  Westin hotels are also known for their comfortable beds though I personally do not notice much of a difference compared to Marriotts.  The Westin in Downtown Charlotte definitely delivered on Westin's contemporary image and comfortable rooms.The rooms are not incredibly modern, but they are contemporary and have a simple and good neutral color scheme.  The design is definitely a notch above a lot of Marriotts that often feature an unappealing color scheme and ugly carpets.  The bed at this Westin was comfortable--excellent linen too and a comfortable room temperature.  The bathroom had a great look and featured a rainfall showerhead.  While I do not have status with Starwood, I did like the nice touch of two complimentary bottles of water with each night (it seems every Starwood member, even non-elite members, enjoy this benefit).This Westin also has a great location.  It is right on College, which leads to several Downtown Charlotte restaurants and even some of Charlotte's nightlife like a dance club and a dueling piano bar.  This Westin is also within walking distance to several key Charlotte attractions including a minor league baseball stadium, the Carolina Panthers (NFL) stadium, the Charlotte Bobcats (NBA) arena, and the NASCAR Hall of Fame.The fitness center was big and had several machines.The lobby was nice too.  It was spacious and there were several sitting areas if you are waiting for someone.I tried a little bit of their catering for a nightly event in their restaurant as well as in one of their banquet rooms for breakfast.  The food was definitely subpar for a Westin.  A lot of it was due to poor preparation and the effects of having buffet style food as the scrambled eggs were not that fluffy, the waffles were very soft and the flatbread was limp (it had definitely been sitting around for too long).Service throughout the hotel was friendly though I felt that housekeeping was a tad slow to service my room on some days.Prices are high, but the hotel is nice and the location is very convenient.For travelers looking to explore Downtown Charlotte, this Westin is a great option.  The rooms are nice and the location is near perfect.  Downtown Charlotte is not my favorite downtown city.  It is a tad sleepy though not as quiet as Phoenix or as small as San Jose.  However, if you need to be in Downtown Charlotte, this Westin is a good hotel for a short or long stay.Pay valet and self parking are both offered by this Westin.  It is easy finding a spot with self parking.Went here for a (crappy) Meetup and while I've been in Charlotte now almost 4 years, I have never been to this hotel. It's on the ourskirts of Uptown, and it is an architecturally impressive hotel....if you look at it from the side, it's kind of got that "bad guy's lair, Gotham" look to it. So we all met in the large Lobby Bar, and ordered quite expensive glasses of wine. The CHEAPEST they had was $10, and they averaged about $13 a glass. Normally I can get those glasses elsewhere for much less but it's hotel prices. Pours were decent though....selection was below average with about 10 red and white wine selections.Staff was OK. Nothing special.This to me was just another nice hotel bar with expensive drink prices and an expensive parking deck (thankfully I had a Meetup voucher or I would have had to pay like $10 for parking - to get their expensive drinks!).Unless you absolutely have a good reason, I wouldn't go out of my way to come here.Beds are great and fitness/pool area is good, people are fantastic. The location was excellent, close to the baseball park, nascar hall of fame.Love the hotel, love the employees. Great service, super nice people! Parking is not my favorite thing here as you have to find a parking spot in the garage attached to the hotel unless you valet. The beds are super comfortable and they bring you extra pillows when requested. As I am a pillow snob and very picky about my pillows I give them extra kudos for the feather pillows.We enjoyed our rooms and the hospitality the staff conveyed.  The only down side was how far of a walk it was to get to any dining or entertainment.  The surrounding parking lots are monitored like prisons constantly harassed by security for just walking through.The front desk staff are amazing! Particularly Kimberly, Adrienne, and Jasper. They always greet with a warm smile and are helpful (even when there is a long line) great individuals and examples of customer service! This is a busy hotel with a ton of demanding business clientele. The hotel is amazingly accommodating despite being booked to capacity almost every night.Amazing hospitality shown to our company FASTSIGNS, we were there for a Sales Summit for our FASTSIGNS store in Rochester, MN and the entire staff was incredible.  If I ever come to Charlotte, NC again this is where I will stay.  The rooms were clean, fabulous, and just overall a great experience.My husband and I stayed here for two nights this past Valentine's Day weekend for our second babymoon. I must say it was hard to leave! Hotel:The Westin is right in Uptown located across from the Convention Center and next to a light rail station, The Epicentre is only a 10-minute walk away (yes, we braved the cold, but it was nice!), and the arena is another few minutes from there. You can pay $25 for valet parking or $18 to self-park (which we did).The lobby area was nice, and check-in was smooth. There is a mini-Starbucks there and a gift/sundries shop around the corner. The elevator bank has six elevators, so we didn't have to wait long (except when we ran into the ACN International Convention attendants coming back from the arena!).Restaurant/Food Service:We didn't eat at the restaurant or indulge in food service, but apparently the breakfast buffet isn$25 per person! If you're here on a Sunday like we were, check out Pike's Soda Shop (a five-minute drive away in South End) for their amazing breakfast and breakfast buffet for $8.95 (before 10am--after that it's $13.95, but they add more food).Room:We booked a corner Superior room on the 23rd floor with gorgeous views of Uptown. It faced north and east, so the sunrise was absolutely beautiful. There is a nice-sized TV, individual thermostat, a desk with chair, an armchair with ottoman, a mini-fridge, and a coffeemaker with Starbucks coffee. They even threw in two free bottles of water (but don't consume the third, or it's $3.95). We didn't hair any noise from neighbors besides one instance of dogs barking (yes, the Westin is pet friendly). If you choose no housekeeping each day you're there (excluding day of departure), you get hooked up with a $5 dining voucher you can keep (or you can exchange that for 500 Starwood points when you check out). We initially had a problem with a non-functioning remote for the TV, but they sent someone up within 15 minutes and took care of it. Also beware that Wifi isn't free, but I believe if you're an SPG member you may not have to pay.Bed:The Heavenly Bed definitely lived up to its name! It was extremely comfortable and hard to get out of. The pillows were a little too soft for my taste, but if you love very soft pillows you're in for a treat! The duvet and sheets are comfortable as well. If you have a corner room, be aware there is a window right behind the bed. It wasn't a big deal with the blackout curtains.Bathroom:The bathroom was a standard hotel bathroom (no exhaust fan, unfortunately). The Heavenly Shower was awesome! It's both a rainfall-type shower, and there is a nice handheld component to it. My only gripe was the bathtub didn't drain well.Conclusion:All in all we had an amazing stay! I highly recommend this hotel. This was our second time staying here, and we will definitely return. :)I really enjoyed my stay at the Westin Charlotte. I stayed in a King Room, with a gorgeous view. My only complaint is that no matter what I set the temp to on my thermostat, my room was FREEZING. Other than that issue, I couldn't have been happier. The beds are SO comfortable. I took a trip to Charlotte alone, on business, and stayed in my room most of the time, while not working. My room was clean, elegant, and that bed! I guess they're called "Heavenly Beds"? It's true. Tons of pillows and clean, white sheets and blankets on probably the most comfortable mattress I've ever slept on. I wanted to take the bed home with me lol. Because my room was cold (I don't know why this room was so cold!) I was in that bed quite a bit. Their customer service is stellar, and although pretty pricey, their food is excellent. I ordered a late-night club sandwich, and it was perfect. The staff at the Westin Charlotte work incredibly hard to make sure you're comfortable, and have all you need for a pleasant stay. Check out is at noon instead of the hotel-common 11 AM, and an extra hour, or 1:00, is complimentary. If you are not a morning person (I'm so not a morning person) or have a late flight, this is a very nice thing. Highly recommended.It's convenient but if you're looking for high end lodging, keep moving along.  The highlight of this property is the gym...seriously.  The rest of the place is fine, and the access to the light rail and convention center are dynamite.  Staff is solid, not overly helpful but solid, and when there are issues they hop to it.  This property rides on the tails of its location, so if that's key, you're good.  If you're looking for top-tier, Westin-style accommodations, you'll be disappointed.I can only speak from the experience of staying here for a recent convention. Several conferees and I had issues with the staff during the event over displays and services. Due to the nature of the event (romance novelists and readers) I got the impression they hovered close in case we decided to cause trouble. I did not find the venue pleasant.While my room was clean, I think the bed aggravated my back pain. I also understand a number of conferees who drank the water experienced discomfort and sore throats.It's the Westin! It's Uptown! I just KNEW I was going to be amazed....and I was not. Perhaps my expectations were just wayyyy to high. But for me everything was just very blah. The staff were all pleasant enough, but they didn't go out of their way to make our stay more enjoyable.The rooms were fine. But I wasn't impressed with anything except for the beds. Those things are super fluffy and comfortable. I do have to give them kudos for the views...especially at night. However, I'm a fan just yet. I'll give them another try...but I'm not really in a hurry.I've stayed here for four years in a row and this go around have noticed a serious decline in service and quality.  There was only one employee available to check people in and after a full day I waited 30 minutes to check in.  As a result, I didn't have time to go up to the room before leaving for dinner.  They said that my bags would be delivered to my room but when I got back at 10:30 p.m., ready to collapse, they were no where to be found.There was standing water in the tub and the shower head was only partially working.  Not the kind of experience I expect from a hotel where there are additional fees for everything - I'm talking $15 for one day of parking!  I have high standards for this place since my previous stays have been great.  Why are you slacking Westin Charlotte?One word "heavenly" beds. Need I say more. I'm a fan of Westin everywhere I travel. The beds alone make it a good stay. This location is ideal, right in the city center. Walking distance from EpiCenter and far enough away from the noise.This Westin was as expected. The staff were friendly, but as another yelper stated. They didn't go out of there way. Being a SPG gold member, we were put in a superior king room. The view of the city was amazing from the room.I checked in thursday morning which was great because I just got in from a redeye flight and it was 10:30 in the morning and they had a room available. Which I took full advantage of and took a nap before my sales conference started.  The room was very nice. I ordered Carolina pulled pork sandwich from their after hours menu. The person who brought the food up to my room said it was the best in Charlotte. Description said grain mustard Cole slaw and pickles. The coleslaw was a couple pieces of lettuce with some carrots. There were no pickles or grain mustard. Then the next night I ordered a turkey club and it is exactly what it said on the menu. The customer service is awesome but they need to  follow what their menu says. Other than that I had a great time. The channels are very scarce and it takes multiple seconds for the channel to change. Either the batteries are almost dead or its just terrible. We live in a time where tv is very simple. Their tv service reminds me of watching TV in the early 90's.Great Stay During Business Travel in Sept 2013Clean, modern, comfortable bed, good gym, indoor pool, two bars, a Starbucks in the lobby, and great downtown location.Side Note, the architect of this building is very cool.
review_content_40: Really enjoyed this place during a conference at the hotel for 600+ people.  Nice upscale appearance, very accommodating staff, and great breakfast and lunches for a big crowd all were reasons for my satisfaction.  Lastly, I requested and received a room with a "roll-in" shower to assist me with a chronic back problem.  That plus the comfortable bed minimized my back discomfort during the meeting.  BTW, special group parking rates and room rates were a great value added factor!  Great place for a meeting.  Just one more thing, you can get takeout from the restaurant if you want to get around the in room fees for dining.I love this hotel.  Love love love.  I stayed years ago for business and was impressed and recently stayed for a wedding weekend and was not let down.  The staff was super nice, the car service was prompt, our room was nice and the location is great.  My only complaint was the A/C in our room was acting really wacky and not coming on and the drinks at the bar (which the patio is a great area outside to relax) were kinda pricey.Fantastic views from the suites were a highlight for us here, as were the comfy beds.  The rooms aren't huge, but they don't really need to be.  Staff was courteous and helpful throughout.  Prices can be a little high, but given the location they aren't outrageous.My wife and I stayed in this hotel for a night this weekend, and overall we had a pretty great experience. But for the money, I'm pretty sure that's expected, we just aren't used to places this nice :-PFor what it's worth though, the beds were great, the room was clean and well kept, and we had pretty much everything we could have wanted there except for a microwave. The staff was very friendly as well.The only real downside to this place is that everything is expensive. Not just the room, but parking was $18/day, and even to rent a movie was expensive ('Gravity' was going for $16!).So if you've got the money to do it, it was a beautiful hotel, just don't forget that the room is only the start of the cost.I stayed at The Westin last week and I have to say it's not nearly as pleasant as it was a few years ago. Within 24 hours of my arrival my sinuses were freaking out. I thought maybe it was the climate change or the dry hotel air. But by day 2 my nose was bleeding and the person sharing my room was also not feeling great. It was then I noticed small mold spots in the shower. (there was no ventilation fan in the bathroom) I was there for a convention so I had to spend a great deal of time inside and by the time I checked out five days later I was miserable and so happy to get out of that hotel. The AC in the room also did not seem to operate properly. I'd wake up in the middle of the night hot despite the room temp being set on 64. No way it got near 64 or I would have been freezing. I fully believe the lack of ventilation and poor AC quality led to my roommate and I both ending up sick. But imagine my surprise when I get back home and complaints start popping up like crazy from dozens of the convention goers who also came home sick. I can't say for sure what the cause was, but I am comfortably saying The Westin in downtown Charlotte is not a healthy hotel. It needs some major work.Staying here is always a treat. I don't necessarily like the parking area, but it serves its purpose. I was here for an event, the lobby area was really crowded but was expected for the event. Seemed a bit unorganized, but the staff was nearby to answer any questions and help out in any way they could. I did have to stand at the bar for about 20 minutes before I could get a bartenders attention to get a drink, but I chalk it up to it being crowded too. The  rooms are nice, comfortable beds, room service is an option and the food from the restaurant is a sight for the eyes, and its pretty good as well.An architectural site, this is one of the better Westin's.Pros:Great restaurant, food is creative and tastyLocation in the middle of downtown CharlotteGreat for the priceCons:Rooms a little bit on the smaller sideOverall, a great stayA beautiful hotel with accommodating staff and good amenities. The catering is splendid. The food is fresh and REALLY good! I don't need to say anymore than what has been said about the beds. Just the best there is. Bathrooms are modern and clean. Charlotte's beauty can be seen out my window. Stay here!BED BUGS. Got 5 bites for one night. The bites caused an infection that was so bad that Dr. gave me 3 antibiotic shots within 24 hrs! He also suggested me to go to ER if not getting better. STAY AWAY!!Great place. Accommodating and the staff was awesomeI had an incident yesterday. They had some sort of rapper or hip hop artist staying in the room next to mine. They were being loud, a lot of cursing and shouting, many doors brig slammed. And this occurred in the room (which was next to mine) and in the hallway. It went on until late at night (4 am)I felt unsafe and not comfortable calling security. I should. Retaliation was my main concern. I expressed my discontent this morning and manager gave me the possibility if late check out, which was nice considering my flight is schedule to depart at 6 pm. All and all it was good, however I would recommend to ANY hotel that have guests that are prone to kiss behave and not obey the rules to either NOT have anyone stay in t contiguous room (or on the floor at all) or to warn them prior to checking them in.I am not certain I would pay full price for this hotel. Yes, it is beautiful -- I absolutely love the architecture. At its height, the hotel is 25 floors. The bed was comfortable, the room was clean, the view was OK. But it is quite typical of other Westin hotels go, as far as the decor and ambiance. Thankfully, the hotel has a lap pool and workout room. The workout room has at least one dozen machines, treadmills and the like. It also has some medicine balls and free weights. Some of the machines have those built-in television sets -- something I'm not fond of, but something that I understand to be popular. The staff here is uber professional. Very direct and, at times, stiff. It can be a bit strange, but you at least feel like they are handling business. And that's about all it is. The hotel does not have a comfortable, cozy feel, per se, likely because 1. This is not a spa, folks. 2. This hotel likely sees mostly individuals shuffling in and out for conferences (the Convention Center is directly across the street). I'm not saying I want to see a juggling bear in costume tossing shaved gold in my direction when I walk in. But, goodness. The lobby is nice, leading to a beautiful and open bar space with free WIFI. Bonus!If you can, pack some crackers, chips or peanuts because the room service menu is somewhat short and there are no decent grocery stores nearby -- though there are a couple convenience stores. And if you brought your own wine but forgot the wine key, call room service. They have those little plastic ones and delivered one to my room. That was awesome.The Westin is your standard business traveler hotel in your standard business traveler city, (which is about as warm and fuzzy as I can get about the stepford city of Charlotte).  It has some really great aspects to it, and some less great aspects:Good.  Great.  Grand, even.1.  The fitness facility has a "club" feel with its low light, and has a good variety of equipment, ample mats, weighted balls, and stability balls.  What it's missing is a good machine for lats, but other than that, it's better than most hotel gyms.2.  That darn bed is so comfortable I can't even stand it.3.  Catering services from the hotel and their meeting space is well-supported, and well-done.  Not so good.  Troubling.  Odd.1.  There's a phenomenon out there called "sensory branding," and one of the ways to engage a customer's senses to get them to remember your brand is via smell, so the hallways are piped with smell.  A horrible, putrid, over-the-top, overpowering lavender-y spell is that so perfurme-y and strong that I literally coughed all the way down the hall to my room.  Having this be your welcome to your room?  I think not.  I held my breath the rest of the week.  2.  The service in the lounge of the hotel is virtually nonexistent.  You'll see your cocktail server every 30 to 40 minutes.  This has been consistent through three different visits to the hotel and its lounge.3.  The person who checked me in assured me of a great view.  The roof of the convention center is not/was not/will never be that.(WiFi is free for Starwood Preferred Guest members, paid for others)Hubby and I like to hang out in Charlotte on the weekends, and this is definately a great hotel. If you want to relax - it is suitable, but if you want to people watch and have a great drink - the lounge works too! The rooms are always the same -  clean, cool and with a descent view of the Queen City! I have called ahead, and booked through the reservations line - and this is the only complaint I have. One time I visited, they did not have my reservation on file. The front desk obviously does not share the information that the main booking line has. They had actually reserved a room in Columbia, SC in error - then charged us for not showing up !? Everything was resolved a week later so we got over it! Also, if you stop in the bar on the way out, or just chill down there to enjoy the view -- you just might run into a celebrity. I refuse to name drop, but we have spotted a couple of celebrities there, and they are usually pretty friendly !There are much better choices in uptown Charlotte!  Let me start with the good...the front desk staff. The three people who assisted me at the front desk were extremely friendly and helpful. Great customer service!Now the bad...stains. There is no other way to describe everything in my room. Multiple stains on the carpeting and the comforter. The bathrobe hanging on the back of the bathroom door had a huge brown stain on the sleeve that I kept telling myself was makeup from the last occupant. Every, yes every, bath towel had a stain (either black or yellow). There was stained grout behind the toilet like it had leaked sometime in the past. Even the shower curtain was stained. Then there was the hair dryer. It was sooooo sticky that I didn't even want to touch it. It appeared to be covered in about 15 years worth of cheap hairspray. I can appreciate that the hotel is getting older and may need a renovation soon, but come on people!  How about you splurge and replace your bath towels and hair dryers now!  Let me be clear that I think the cleaning staff is doing the best they can with what they have been given. They just need a better starting product!Stayed here while working the NASCAR race at the nearby Charlotte Motor Speedway. I'm glad the room was paid for by the company, as I don't feel like it was really a $170/night room. There wasn't anything wrong, particularly, but it wasn't "all that" either. The gym and pool looked decent. The bed was very, very comfy. Food (including room service) was WAY over-priced. The location right downtown, near the convention center is great. I would suggest taking a walk over to Brevard Court, near Church street to hit the little alley of bars and restaurants. They've got great atmosphere and reasonable prices (The Belfast and Valhalla in particular).There is a lot to like about this place. The amenities are very good. Starbucks in the bedroom, flat screen TV, a bed that's probably more comfortable than your own, clean bathrooms with toiletries you want to stuff into your bag each night, etc.The only downside is this sneaking feeling that almost everything costs just a little bit extra. It seems ridiculous. You could go to a cheaper, less good hotel, and all the amenities and perks are complimentary. But here, at the Westin, it seems, if they don't get you in the wash, then they'll get you in the rinse. So far the only thing "complimentary" here seems to be the workout center.So drop the cash and enjoy the comfort, just don't think about dropping the cash until after your stay.We always stay here when in Charlotte. I've always had a clean king room and friendly, efficient service. Full service Starbucks coffee downstairs in the lobby. The room has free Starbucks medium roast coffee, with coffee maker in your room. A mini fridge and safe are built into the dresser the TV sits on.There's a make-up mirror, hair dryer, iron and ironing board in the room too. They have a good breakfast buffet in Embers. It's a bit pricy though. Having the affordable light rail (it's NOT FREE) right behind the hotel is VERY Convenient too. You won't have to take a taxi to get to the Time Warner cable arena. But if you need a ride they offer towncar service out of the hotel for a decent rate. There's convention space in the hotel and the Charlotte convention center is right next door. Be sure to sign up for the SPG rewards so you can earn a free night at an SPG property.I love attending events at The Westin Charlotte.  The staff members are always attentive and courteous.  Today, parking was included with the event so that made it even better!  Lunch (baked chicken, mashed potatoes and green beans) was quite tasty and the event (Goodwill Cornerstone Luncheon) was fabulous, as always.  I continue to receive inspiration from the Good Works recipients.Let me say that once the luncheon was over, getting TO the parking garage was quite a task (slow elevators or walking the ramps with the exiting cars), then getting OUT of the garage was an extremely slow process.  BEWARE!  Had it not been for Speed Week, I would have parked elsewhere.NOTE:  I am unable to check in at The Westin.  Yelp says I am 13 miles away...So I've stayed at this hotel several times now.  I really enjoy the convenient location to the light rail.  There are several good local spots to eat at just off the light rail's route.  The breakfast Buffett in the lobby is expensive, but pretty good.  I've had drinks at the bar down stairs, and let me tell you that you'll be paying full price for under poured cocktails.  I've never had an issue with the staff.  They've always been helpful and friendly.  They have a car service available out front, so you can roll in style, for a price.  If you have the extra cash, not a bad spot to stay.In Charlotte for  conference.  Everyone has been incredibly nice, and helpful.  Good location. Walking distance to other hotels, shopping and dining.  Next door to Charleston Convention Center.
review_content_60: Stayed here for about 3 days since there was a conference going on.I would say it is in a pretty nice location.  Located at the end of Uptown (?), I did walk up Tryon and College St. a bit to check out the rest of the Uptown area, and it was no more than 10-15 minutes walking to the different restaurants.For a Westin, it is one of the newer ones I've been to.  Westin really knows how to design their lobby and create a spacious setting.  The lobby is relaxed and oddly welcoming, which you can't really say about a lot of hotels.The staff was courteous and we checked in with no problem.  The rooms were a nice surprise as it is fairly spacious.  All the usual amenities are there, such as internet, LCD TV etc, and who doesn't love the Heavenly bed and the shower heads??  Although one thing I didn't like was definitely the lack of a mini-fridge.  They only had the mini-bar fridge and you have to request a key to unlock it.  Even after you do unlock it, there's no room for you to put anything there, and I was too afraid of getting charged if anything was moved.Internet does cost around $13 a night, which is fairly high, but at this point, I've accepted the charges for internet is an expense I will be paying.The gym at this Westin is amazing.  The gym is connected to the pool with a "refresh area" after you swim.  The gym itself is quite big, especially for hotel standards!  Bikes, elliptical, plenty of treadmills, and a few weight-training machines.  All the cardio machines have their own TV and if you have your headphones, you can just plug it in.  Even if you don't have headphones, they have disposable headphones there that you can use for free!  They also provide fresh towels, as well as water dispensers.  I definitely took advantage of the gym while I stayed there.As for the conference space, it does a pretty good job, with plenty of meeting rooms and ballrooms.  Of course, the conference i was attending only had several hundred of people, which isn't that big for a conference.  Caterting was done right near the escalators.I didn't eat the restaurants on location since most of the meals were taken care of by the conference but I did check it price... and I would definitely venture out and explore the city a bit.  For the same price, I could probably check out a nice steakhouse around the area.Would definitely try to stay here again next time if I'm able to visit Charlotte again!Friendly staff. Super comfy bed. Awesome shower head. Can't go wrong. Unfortunately, wifi isn't free, so plan accordingly. Within walking distance most downtown happenings. Appreciated the town car service. I mean, who doesn't like rolling up in a black Escalade. Drivers were friendly too and offered Charlotte-centric tips.I expected much more from a Westin. Cons-The toilet didn't look very clean and the comforter had some stains.-Expensive parking-Mini bar, no fridge-$20 continental breakfastPros:-Convenient location-Radio with iPod dockI'm in a pretty unique position to write this review as I have a law school friend who stays here almost every weekend and the wife and I meet up with him most times.  I've seen about 10-15 different rooms and we've hung out in the lobby spaces extensively, especially since we tend to start our runs from here on Sundays.I'm a big fan of this Westin.  As others have mentioned, the lounge is very modern and chic, lots of marble and a really cool Zen fountain running the length of the bar seating area.  The conference rooms are also on two separate floors adjacent to the lobby- great for easy access and they have separate elevator service that runs straight down into the parking garage.The restaurant downstairs does a really mean breakfast buffet and their lunch menu is far from an after-thought- tasty grilled flatbreads.The rooms are what you expect in any newer Westin- heavenly bed with mainly modern style furniture- clean lines and neutral earth tone colors.  Bathrooms are done in marble with large mirrors and glass enclosed showers.  Here's a hint for you- try to get a room or suite on the ends of the hallways- the showers have an extra window that looks out onto uptown- but the tinted glass makes sure others don't see in.  The square footage in these bathrooms is also quite a bit bigger than a standard room.I also like the views from any of the upper floors of this hotel.  Due to it's location on the edge of the uptown sky scrapers, rooms that face town have a great ariel view of uptown and/or Panthers Stadium.  But even the rooms facing the opposite direction look out towards the light rail line and South End- on clear days you can see out to Carowinds at the state line.  Really no terrible views here.My only downgrade here is for the weekend crowds that flock into this hotel.  Interesting people watching, to say the least, but the circular driveway gets way too crowded at times and entry/exit becomes a  game of trying to move the puzzle pieces around until it all fits.  Parking is also quite expensive unless you have elite status here, but then that's pretty much anywhere in uptown.Expect larger crowds for the bigger conventions in town as this hotel is literally across the street from the convention center.  Convenient for guests but a slight traffic headache.I had a tremendously positive experience at this Westin (the 12th-ish or so I've stayed at this year).  - Beautiful, very new-seeming property- Great location pretty close to anything you'll need- Reasonable prices on self-parking- Excellent service- Extremely clean, well-kept and comfy space (I was on the 22nd floor...so I suppose I can only speak for it)- Upgraded to a corner suite that was amazing---very well appointed, functional and comfortableAgain, this is my 12th or so Westin stay this year---and it has been the best of all of those.Beautiful lounge downstairs that doubles as a lobby/workspace and hotel bar. Great place to work, wait for someone, or hang out for a drink (my work team definitely had to do all three). The rooms were extremely nice as well with amenities (fridge and iron, essential for a work hotel room). This location is completely walkable to the rest of the downtown area. They also sometimes have flavored ice water in the lobby which was a nice touch. My only complaint was how overpriced breakfast was (the hotel bar was a bit overpriced, but not exceedingly so). $10 for an English muffin and a coffee? However, our server was very friendly and attentive -  and they also give you your coffee in a to go cup after you finish your sit down breakfast. Nothing like 3 cups of coffee and a spare before you get to a conference.Clean hotel, friendly staff, good location to get around when visiting for work and the hotel bar is a nice place to grab a drink after a long day.They must have read my review. Since my last visit, they remodeled the hotel bar and improved the seating capacity. The hotel restaurant menu was revamped and now offer an all-you-can-eat cold or hot breakfast with over 20 items to choose from. Much much better!Also, several towncars and SUVs waiting outside to take you to the airport for a similar flat rate as a cab but far more roomy and stylish.Pros: Super comfy beds and nice amenities like Starbucks coffee in the room. Cons- room did not have a hair dryer, we had a room for four people but were only provided towels for two.Stayed here for a week for a conference in town, and it was like home away from home. I had a very comfortable stay. Location was great. I was able to walk around the downtown area with no problem. The restaurant on the first floor was very good, and I ended up eating there almost every night. That, and also I couldn't really find other "healthier" options in walking distance. The bartenders at the restaurant/bar were also very nice. One bartender in particular (and I forgot his name, sorry), on my last night of stay, gave me free drinks, which was very kind of him.  The gym was clean and spacious, and also empty most of the time, which I loved. The wireless internet, on the other hand, was unnecessarily expensive ($15 per day? WHY??) and slow. I used their room service for breakfast twice (I was feeling lazy)- also tasty and you can find "healthier" options on the menu. Their Starbucks in the lobby, however, was closed a lot of times, and the closest coffee place was about five blocks away, which was a bummer..But all in all, if I ever make it back to Charlotte again, I would most likely stay at the Westin again.Great hotel. Bed was comfy, room clean and the bar relaxing. Kudos to Brian (front desk) and Jarrell at the bar - great staff! The view from our 25th floor was fantastic. Would definitely stay again!Beautiful view from the room and the BATHROOM !!!!Staff was very helpful, Rooms clean - Embers restaurant food good but limited menu. All week the ice machine on floor 23 and 24 did not work. Called front desk but problem was never fixed - the whole week. Also they working on the pool deck area so we could not go out and relax on the deck on some of the most awesome sunny days.The maids did and awesome job every day !The nitty-gritty:1.  Location is great, walkable to Uptown attractions.  If you're sticking local, you don't need a car.  If you want one, there's a Hertz at the hotel, but you'd probably be better to rent at CLT and skip the rail to the hotel or $25 flat-rate taxi.2.  The Internet is $12.95 / day. It never worked for us, which was a major bummer. I put in a call with IT, who forwarded it to "advanced IT," but despite calling on day one of a four day stay, I never heard back.3.  Parking is $18 / day and in-room movies are $14 - $16 / each.  Breakfast buffet is $19 and has everything except waffles and pancakes.4.  The pool is NOT open 24-hours, as the hotel's website advertises.  It closes at 10pm, and there were always kids there when we tried to go.  It'd be great if 9pm-11pm was grown-up only pool time.5.  The hotel is GORGEOUS.6.  The staff was extremely friendly, though seemed a little inexperienced.  There was rarely anybody at the concierge desk, and staff recommended odd things, like taking the rail one stop ($1.75) instead of walking .3 miles because "you'd have to cross a big intersection."  7. The bed is PURE HEAVEN.8. The hotel room has no fridge!  This is a major drawback in a city known for outstanding restaurants and huge portions, and more than once we had to decline to-go boxes.  I've never thrown away pan-seared branzino or salmon with lobster before, and I hope to never do so again.stayed here for less than 18 hours, so I really can't justify giving it more stars.  nothing spectacular, but nothing offensivethe bed was comfy, the room was fine.  I was attending a meeting & the food was not very good- but that could be because of what was ordered.  vegan options were slim to none (even the granola bars they had a snack were dairy & they could not find soy milk for coffee, WTF?)I do have to say they have a GREAT gym- huge with lots of equipment & space.I wanted to give it three stars because the lobby was so great, the bar and bar staff were awesome and the beds were comfortable enough. But for the rate that we paid the cleanliness of our hotel room was unacceptable. There was a massive stain in the middle of the floor and left over beverages from the last occupants, and a stain on the comforter. Big disappointment...try the Hilton.I've actually been here at least 3 or 4 times now and it's fine. It's a Westin. Pretty consistent as a chain in my opinion. Been to about half a dozen now and they all seem to match up pretty evenly more or less. A solid option before you leap up the prices to luxury status. That said, if you're curious about the nicer Westins, I would say that perhaps the nicest I've seen is the one in Minneapolis. After that, Boston.I went to an event lasy night at the Westin Hotel,  its a yearly event that has been hosted at the westin for years.  This year was smaller than the past due I think mostly because people are not happy with the continued issues of under staffing at the bar.  It took about 30 min to get a drink, and once again they ran out of vodka.  I would think because of past experiences with this group they would be better prepared.  There was so much lost revenue, last night because I saw a lot of people including my group that just left and went elsewhere to get a drink.The main bathroom off the lobby was one of the most disgusting I have encountered.  one stall was roped off with no toilet at all,  there was  a broken bottle in the other shattered all over the floor, no towels, and one had overflowed.  Wouldnt you think they would have an attendant check on the bathroom on occasion.My recemendation is step it up Westin,  I assure you I wont be back unless you do..I hope this group considers another venue, want that wants the business, as it seems the westin is not interested..I really looked forward to writing a good review based on my first initial impression, but sadly, I cannot.The architecture is beautiful inside & out.  The rooms are comfortable & modern & OH MY - the beds & pillows. I wanted to secretly haul them out with me & bring them home. Nice flat screen TV's, a mini bar, nice room service offerings, beautiful views, & double shower heads in the shower. Radio with iPod dock. Location of the hotel to downtown is perfect. These all deserve 5 stars.Now for the bad. :( Paying to park - we were there from 9 PM December 31st - 10:45 AM January 1st. Our parking debt was $18, which was already billed on our check out summary. Paid internet - $12.95 for like 3 MB. Seriously?! And here is a rundown of our New Year's Eve: We had somewhat prepared ourselves for loud activity around 2 / 3 AM; however, we were not prepared for 2 straight hours of our "next door neighbor" playing an acoustic guitar, having guests coming & going slamming the door, & loud talking outside our door / through the wall.  We endured 30 minutes prior to making the first call to the front desk, asking for someone to contact this guest.  The employee stated she would send someone from security up.  A few minutes later, the guitar music briefly stopped.  However, it started up again soon after. Again, we called down to the front desk, explained the issue at hand, & was given the same response. The music continued.  Around 4:15, my boyfriend got out of bed, went downstairs & pleaded for some assistance.  Again, he was told that security would come.  No one came.  Around 4:30 / 4:45 AM, he called the front desk again & was told the issue was "pending & that meant it was taken care of". Unfortunately, "pending" in normal circumstances does not mean "taken care of".  My boyfriend waited at our door to ensure someone was in fact coming to handle this noise complaint.  Finally at around 5 AM, security came, knocked on their door & asked them to "keep it down". It was at that point, there was silence.Was it necessary we had to go through all this?  Therefore, my perfect NYE hopes did not end on a high note.This hotel is so swanky! It looks so cool outside with their chic building design, concierge service, and a lot of the amenities you'd expect from such an establishment. So why the low rating? I'll elaborate!The positives? My room on the 25th floor had a pretty cool view. The beds are super comfy and fluffy. The rest of the room is just okay. The room and bath I'll be nice and call cozy. There's free wifi, the ubiquitous minibar with astonishing prices, and a nice breakfast.Here's the bad points. Staying here treats you to surly employees that don't even look at you when answering a question. I mean seriously why you gotta be so mean to me after I checked out?! I asked if I could get my parking validated since I didn't have a room key to get out for free anymore, and parking is some ridiculous price of about $7 per hour. So preoccupied with his little computer screen he was that he didn't even look at me and waved me off with a we don't validate parking here, pay the machine on your way out. Seriously? I know I look a bit young and my clothes were kinda grungy when I left but the housekeeping when I first got here was nicer to me than you were. At least she made sure I got to where I was going when I was looking a bit lost.So I ended up paying the parking fee of $7, but I think I'll be heading to the Ritz Carlton in the future where I'm sure they'll at least treat me with some modicum of respect instead of treating me like I came in off the street begging for some change.I am writing this after my horrible Omni experience because now I appreciate my experience here even more. The staff are great and I had a very wonderful experience. I didn't get that intrusive uncomfortable feeling like I did at the Omni. The room was very modern and their electronics were up to date including the ipod deck and the mini bar. The room was CLEAN and large just like the bathroom. And the view from the large windows was beautiful.
review_content_80: Consistent with other Westins.  Staff was welcoming and friendly.  Room was clean and comfortable.I'm giving this 3 stars because of the nice modern decor, and because of the fact that they always called us by our names when we called the front desk (I'm a sucker for that kind of thing).We were in town for a comic book convention, so we got a rate of $119 per night. This still seems expensive, but it was a popular weekend so we didn't shop around much more.The wait for the elevators was ridiculous! I guess that there's not much that can be done about such a thing, but waiting for 10 minutes at a time because every elevator that stops is FULL TO THE BRIM with people was annoying. At once point, my husband took the stairs back to our room WHICH WAS ON THE ELEVENTH FLOOR after visiting the Starbucks in the lobby. Oh, and it's not a full Starbucks so they didn't even have iced coffee...???The room was nice- we were on the end of a hallway, which I had heard was good because of the views and tons of windows. There were a ton of windows, but they overlooked construction and highways. Meh. The shower/bathtub situation was pretty awesome, also with tons of windows (there were shades, if you wished to pull them down!). There seemed to be no fan in the bathroom, though, which surprised me. Also, there was a burnt out bulb in the bathroom, right near the magnifying mirror; when we called down to the front desk to have it replaced they said it would take them a while...and it did. Also, this is a small thing, but they put lotion in the shower instead of shampoo (next to the conditioner). So I washed my hair with lotion. Yeah.We visited the bar on Saturday night between 10 and 11 and it was insane. It took us 40 minutes to get a drink, which we expected, but people behind us were being served first! I guess that's our fault for not being savvy enough to know how to get served in bars? Also, one bartender with red curly hair was making drinks kind of ridiculously- packing more ice in when she ran out of something and choosing things at random to pour in the glasses. We were glad the the person who finally served us (our overpriced cocktails) seemed to be measuring a little more carefully.A few more details: Parking is $18 and they bill it to your room; pretty standard for a downtown Charlotte hotel, but not exactly a welcome charge on your bill. The pool is inside. Someone on Yelp said that there is a rooftop bar at the Westin, but they must have gotten rid of it because we were told there was no such thing when we asked.In conclusion, I think I prefer the Courtyard Marriot a few blocks over, on Tryon. The location is a little better, the rooms a little cheaper, and the pool is outdoors (on a rooftop!).Westins have the best bed linens...my room was a little too hot for me...air set to 64 and was still a bit warm.  Otherwise, very nice place.This is a good hotel to stay in when you are at Charlotte, the only bad thing about this hotel is that they don't have complimentary breakfast (however that seems to be pretty standard now for the nicer hotels). We were on one of the higher floors and the view was great. The linen was clean and the staff was friendly.The location was also very walking friendly for all your downtown exploration needs.The hotel park is very expensive - $18/nt. I recommend going around the corner, there's a $6 parking garage you can park in during nights and weekends.My husband and I were here for a wedding and it happened to be the same weekend as the Coke a Cola 600. So, there were a ton of people and we were always greeted with a smile and even given an early checkin and late check out. Our room had an amazing view of downtown, but I did notice that the comforter was not clean. I'm hoping it was a coffee stain. Minus that everything was up to par and would live to stay here again.I've been to better Sheratons and what hotel sends staff to knock on the door at 8:30pm telling me that I'm playing my banjo too loudly.  Never happened before and I'm in the thick of bluegrass country.My stay at this hotel was on the expensive side but I certainly did not think this was a luxurious experience. When I checked in they told me they only had double bed rooms even though I specifically requested a king sized bed. I walked into my room and noticed how stuffy and warm it was even though the ac was at 60 degrees. I had to change rooms and was moved to a lower tier room with no view and was located right next to the elevator so there were loud noises throughout the night. My bed was probably pretty old since there was a slump in the middle of it which made it uncomfortable to sleep in. This Westin was not as modern as I had expected it to be and I was pretty disappointed. The mini fridge was pretty useless since it didn't keep anything cold. All the channels on the TV had frost so I wasn't able to watch anything. Front desk staff was nice and friendly. I wouldn't stay here again though since I can get a better quality room for a much lower price in Charlotte. The location of the hotel is not even that convenient, unless you are in Charlotte for a convention.I am only giving them a 5 because of the service I received.  I have stayed here before and the rooms are always great and this time I unfortunately got a room that must have had a party in it.  Stains on the carpet and the walls were damaged and marked up.I love Starwood brand hotels.  This Westin is a very well run hotel.  I have stayed here several times for business. The service is excellent.  The rooms well done. The catering is outstanding.  The restaurants and bars are well done. The location is ok with a quick walk to the heart of Charlotte.  Stay here you won't be disappointed.You had to pay $15 per day for Internet access.  The beds were uncomfortable.  The room keys did not work in the parking garage even though they claimed to fix them twice.  The bar us hideously overpriced.Want a sode in the middle of the night?  Gotta buy it from the gift store before it closes.  1 coke = $300.  I will NEVER be back.Downtown.close to the airport and directly across the street from the Convention center.I love this hotel. For some, it might seem too 'far' from downtown (3 blocks), but for me it's in great location. Walk to everything, including the Stadium, Convention Center, Downtown, and the Epicenter. Service is great - I would expect it! It's the Westin! From the time you get out of a scorching hot taxi (even with air conditioning on) up until the time you leave at 6 in the morning 3 days later. I haven't experience a single hiccup (except a spider in my bathtub that scared the hell out of me one night). Amenities are great:Room - 4 stars. Last time I was here, I got a room with a great walking shower bathroom. This time, it was the regular small bathroom. Last time, my friend managed to get a room with a treadmill (yes, they exist!), this time they were all sold out. I got stuck on the 6th floor, she got stuck on the fourth floor. This was an upgrade for me, as last time I was on the 4th floor as well. Ok, enough bitching. The rooms are great. Beds are called heavenly for a reason and all the condiments and towels and sheets are so fresh you feel energized be mere being in the room. Air Conditioning is a bit loud so either turn if off for the night or bring ear plugs.Gym - 5 stars. From the variety of the workout options to the gym facilities - everything screams class. Perfectomundo! Individual TV screens for every machine (bike, elliptical, treadmill) help time pass by while working out and watching "True Blood" on HBO. Hmmm. Plenty of channels to choose from, though. Sauna, showers, and the locker room are squeaky clean with plenty of extra shampoo, lotion and mouth wash.Pool - 3 stars. Even though this is a great big lap pool, it's too shallow - only 3  1/2 feet deep. I understand that they don't want kids to drown there if unattended, but come on, waist-deep pool is not very appealing to me.Ember Grill - 4 stars. I have only been here for breakfast - I can't complain, except for the prices. $18 for breakfast is a little steep. However, you can eat all you want from 6 a.m. to 10 a.m. and nobody will kick you out (not that I have done that, I swear!).Business Center - 1 star. Ok, what they call a business center is actually a 50 square foot room with 3 workstations, a printer and a fax machine. Internet is pay-per-minute, except to check in on your airline's website and print the boarding pass (which was actually all I needed from the Business Center). However, for travelers who actually need a business center - better bring the laptop and stay in your room with $12.95/day internet service.Airport Transportation - 5 stars. Checking out at 4 a.m.? Take advantage of the flat rate towncar that will take you directly to the airport. Air-conditioned bliss!Ok, let's summarize: I would give this hotel a solid 4 stars and would definitely stay here again. Not because I have to, but because I loved it twice!Doesn't get much better!The Westin is a wonderful hotel with outstanding staff in a great location.  This was my first trip to downtown Charlotte and I was very impressed.  The room was immaculate and very comfortable.  I enjoyed the breakfast buffet one morning which was absolutely delicious with many choices from healthy to the more decadent!  My server was very friendly and attentive.They have several towncards/SUV's available to take you to the airport (no reservation required) for the same price as a cab.  This was a great amenity too!Highly recommend!Stayed here for a few weeks and enjoyed my time for the most part.  Cons are that it is expensive and gets very busy sometimes being so connected with the convention center.  There is often something crazy going on.  Garage parking is steep and they also charge for in-room internet unless you have a certain preferred status level.Pros are the location in Uptown (easily walkable to many eateries and sundries), awesome views, comfortable beds, great gym with pool, and the in-hotel restaurant, Ember Grille, which is pretty good.  Easily one of the top hotels in Charlotte, though we are limited in our options!Like most other Westins, the decor is very nice, and rooms are spacious and full of amenities. The bar and the restaurant is pretty good. Location is in  downtown, but certainly on the edge of town.Deducting one star since they don't have a platinum/concierge lounge.Don't waste your time staying here if you are a business traveler. The Internet is awful and they don't support iPhone or iPad So many better options aroundStayed here almost every week for about 8 months and it's your typical Westin. The doormen when you're entering and leaving are a bit annoyingly intrusive at times and the front desk staff, while pretty good generally, don't really remember you - except there are 2-3 who are quite great.The reason why I give it 3-stars is that this is like a conference hotel - so many types of groups flow in and out every week that the hotel seems a bit over-used, though you don't really see too much wear-and-tear.Location:About a 10-15 minute walk from uptown epicenter and at night you have to walk by a few shady homeless people to get back. Hyatt, Hilton, St. Regis, and Aloft seem to be much better bets when it comes to location.Rooms:Standard Westin rooms with the white tea scented soaps/shampoos and Starbucks coffee packs - nothing too extraordinary or exciting. Gym:Really good in terms of both cardio and weights. This is one of the best parts of the hotel. Overall, nothing impressive or unimpressive. It pretty much meets your expectations of a Westin. Just a bit too many conference attenders pouring in and out every week.Great location especially if in town for a Panthers games. Clean rooms, comfy beds and nice staff. Late night lounge / bar scene is pretty good as well. Been here about 10 times and I'll come back again.I stayed three nights at the Westin with a group for a conference. The staff was courteous in all of my interactions with them, which were few.  The room was tiny for the amount of money that we were paying, but it was clean. I was a bit upset that their website advertised in-room refrigerators, but the only fridge was the mini-bar which required a hotel staffer to open (and which was labelled as being 'not for guest items'). Having specific dietary requirements, I had planned on using the fridge to purchase small items that i could snack on during the conference that I was attending.
